meanings.definition: A person who is lazy or avoids work.
meanings.sent1: The idlers in the office always find excuses to avoid their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The manager warned the idlers that they needed to improve their work ethic.
meanings.sent3: The idlers at the park preferred lounging around instead of helping with the cleanup.
meanings.sent4: The idlers in the group project were like anchors, dragging down the team's progress.
meanings.sent5: The image of the idlers lazing in the sun stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A wheel or roller that does not transmit power but is used to guide or support a belt or chain.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic inspected the idlers in the machinery to ensure they were functioning properly.
meanings.sent2: The conveyor belt had several idlers strategically placed to keep the belt aligned.
meanings.sent3: The idlers on the assembly line quietly did their job, unnoticed by many.
meanings.sent4: The idlers on the bike chain smoothly guided the movement of the pedals.
meanings.sent5: The idlers on the pulley system helped distribute the weight evenly.
